item.title: Amazon AI coding agent hacked to inject data wiping commands
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A hacker planted data wiping code in a version of Amazon's generative AI-powered assistant, the Q Developer Extension for Visual Studio Code. [...]

item.title: Microsoft investigates outage affecting Microsoft 365 admin center
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft is investigating an ongoing outage blocking Microsoft 365 administrators with business or enterprise subscriptions from accessing the admin center. [...]

item.title: The role of the cybersecurity PM in incident-driven development
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by ThreatLocker
item.description: From PowerShell abuse to USB data theft, modern threats hit fast—and hard.vSee how security-minded PMs are responding with real-time controls, smarter policies, and tools like ThreatLocker Patch Management. [...]

item.title: US sanctions North Korean firm, nationals behind IT worker schemes
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The U.S. Department of the Treasury's Office of Foreign Assets Control (OFAC) has sanctioned three North Korean nationals and a company for supporting fraudulent IT worker schemes that generated illicit revenue for the Democratic People's Republic of Korea (DPRK) government. [...]

item.title: Woman gets 8 years for aiding North Koreans infiltrate 300 US firms
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Christina Marie Chapman, a 50-year-old woman from Arizona, was sentenced to 102 months in prison after pleading guilty to her involvement in a scheme that enabled North Korean IT workers to infiltrate 309 U.S. companies. [...]

item.title: Microsoft lifts Windows 11 update block for Easy Anti-Cheat users
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft has removed a compatibility hold that prevented some Easy Anti-Cheat users from installing the Windows 11 2024 Update because of a known issue that triggers restarts with blue screen of death (BSOD) errors. [...]

item.title: BlackSuit ransomware extortion sites seized in Operation Checkmate
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Law enforcement has seized the dark web extortion sites of the BlackSuit ransomware operation, which has targeted and breached the networks of hundreds of organizations worldwide over the past several years. [...]

item.title: OpenAI confirms ChatGPT Agent is now rolling out for $20 Plus users
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: ChatGPT Agent is now rolling out to users with $20 Plus subscription, but OpenAI warns that it will take a few days for the rollout to finish. [...]

item.title: New Koske Linux malware hides in cute panda images
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A new Linux malware named Koske may have been developed with artificial intelligence and is using seemingly benign JPEG images of panda bears to deploy malware directly into system memory. [...]

item.title: Hacker sneaks infostealer malware into early access Steam game
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A threat actor called EncryptHub has compromised a game on Steam to distribute info-stealing malware to unsuspecting users downloading the title. [...]

item.title: Mitel warns of critical MiVoice MX-ONE authentication bypass flaw
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Mitel Networks has released security updates to patch a critical-severity authentication bypass vulnerability impacting its MiVoice MX-ONE enterprise communications platform. [...]

item.title: Hackers breach Toptal GitHub account, publish malicious npm packages
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Hackers compromised Toptal's GitHub organization account and used their access to publish ten malicious packages on the Node Package Manager (NPM) index. [...]

item.title: SonicWall urges admins to patch critical RCE flaw in SMA 100 devices
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: SonicWall urges customers to patch SMA 100 series appliances against a critical authenticated arbitrary file upload vulnerability that can let attackers gain remote code execution. [...]
